cards.rules_text:
Kicker—{B}
Choose one. If it was kicked, choose both instead.
• Put a card with putrefy from exile into your graveyard.
• Return target creature or Vehicle card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]I remember the fallen, do they think of me?[/i]
cards.notes:
V1: March of the drowned B
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target Pirate cards from your graveyard to your hand.

Maybe revisit this choice, as in the format it will be very hard to ever have two pirate cards in the yard


Maybe instead,
Return creature
Return vehicle
Return pirate
Return zombie?

What if it was:
One or both:
Return a creature to hand
Pu a card you own with reanimate from exile to hand (maybe too much recursion) (maybe goes to graveyard instead)


V2:
Choose one or both —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Put a card with reanimate from exile into your graveyard.

Notes: the order of the modes here matters a lot. Intuitively you might imagine that you could put a reanimate card from exile into graveyard then return it to hand, but you can't. Functionally, I like this, though, as it reduces excessive recursion (otherwise you're seeing the same creature up to FOUR times).


V3: (make it only one choice)
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Put a card with reanimate from exile into your graveyard.

Notes: This might make it feel less bad when you can't get both value, but also helps to make the card more intuitive regarding mode order.

V4: (fix this with power level of card)
Trawl the Depths B
(or) Bones in the Ocean
Kicker—1B (You may pay an additional 1B as you cast this spell.)
Choose one. If it was kicked, choose both instead.
• Put a card with reanimate from exile into your graveyard.
• Return target creature or Vehicle card from your graveyard to your hand.

What's needed in blue?
-more spells?

-artifacts enable/payoff (make mana for artifacts?)
-Ward? (maybe a ward sailor)
-cantrip

V1
3U
3/4
Sailing
Hexproof

Notes: Hexproof and sailing is weird to put on a common because of the ability to crew in response to a spell, which is a complicated interaction for a common... although this might be the sweet spot for common complexity: a new player can understand what it does, but it might take a skilled player to take maximum advantage of it.

cards.notes:
V1:

Construct the Dawn Fleet — RGW
Enchantment
Immensity — At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one. If the total power of creatures you control is 10 or greater, choose both:
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
• You may look at the top card of your library and you may play creature or Vehicle cards from the top of your library until end of turn.

Idea: Maybe this needs to be more like Elena de Ludio — able to stradle the line between multiple potential archetypes in terms of color requirements

V2: Use this slot for a totally different idea
Mechanosaur Prototype (2)
0/0
This creature enters with a +1/+1 counter on it and your choice of a counter from among flying, first strike, deathtouch, hexproof, lifelink, menace, reach, trample, vigilance, or +1/+1.
When this creature dies, put its counters on target creature you control.

V3: I liked the version where it could die automatically.
Cost (3)
0/0
This creature enters with your choice of two counters from among deathtouch, hexproof, lifelink, menace, reach, trample, vigilance, or +1/+1.
When this creature dies, put its counters on target creature you control.

V4: More control over what counters can be combined
This creature enters with your choice of a counter from among deathtouch, trample, menace, and +1/+1, and your choice of a counter from among reach, lifelink, vigilance and +1/+1.
When this creature dies, put its counters on target creature you control.

V5: Further limit options of counters
3
This creature enters with your choice of a counter from among trample, menace, and +1/+1, and your choice of a counter from among lifelink, vigilance and +1/+1.
When this creature dies, put its counters on target creature you control.

V6: Even more extreme
2
This creature enters with your choice of a counter from among vigilance and +1/+1, and your choice of a counter from among trample and +1/+1.
When this creature dies, put its counters on target creature you control.

Notes: Love this design as it sort of foreshadows the Mechanosaurus Rex

cards.notes:
V1:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a race counter on this enchantment and have target creature you control explore X times, where X is the number of race counters on this enchantment. If you do, an opponent gains control of this enchantment.

Note: redesign. Not happy with this symmetrical effect, probably feels bad for the caster as-is

Ideas:
Something to do with haste? (haste is not really right for this color pair though...)
